1.title_api: Blue Bombers, Tiger-Cats get into head games
1.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats head coach June Jones fully expects the Winnipeg Blue Bombers, who are coming off of a bye week, “to do some funny things” on Friday.
1.desc_api: Between Winnipeg coach Michael O’Shea and his penchant for special teams strategems and Hamilton coach June Jones’ run-and-shoot attack, each team has a lot to think about going into Friday night’s CFL showdown.

2.title_api: Scouting report: Delvin Breaux a maybe for Ticats-Blue Bombers tilt
2.caption_api: Defensive back Delvin Breaux, right, will be a game time decision after injuring himself in a collision with a teammate at practice earlier this week.
2.desc_api: Both Hamilton (3-4) and Winnipeg (4-3) are dealing with key injuries in their defensive coverage

3.title_api: How seven Hamilton Tiger-Cats defensive backs became housemates
3.caption_api: Seven Ticats defensive backs — from left to right, John Green, Jackson Bennett, Richard Leonard, Mariel Cooper, Frankie Williams, Jumal Rolle and Cariel Brooks — have rented a house together this season.
3.desc_api: After rookie defensive back Jackson Bennett found a place after training camp, teammates scrambling for accommodation all ended up living under the same Cannon Street roof.

4.caption_api: Edmonton Eskimos’ Derel Walker (87) is grabbed by B.C. Lions’ T.J. Lee (6) after making a recption during second half CFL football action in Vancouver on Thursday, August 9, 2018. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darryl Dyck
4.desc_api: Van carries Lions over Eskimos 31-23; Lulay reaches 20,000 career passing yards

19.caption_api: Dustin Johnson poses with a Royal Canadian Mounted Police officer while wearing his RCMP Stetson after winning the Canadian Open Sunday at Glen Abbey in Oakville.
19.desc_api: If this is indeed the end, then the leaderboard heading into its last day spoke loudly to the history of Glen Abbey, just as the players had been doing all week.

20.caption_api: Mackenzie Hughes, of Dundas, puts on a Toronto Maple Leafs jersey on after teeing off on the seventh hole during the final round of the Canadian Open Sunday.
20.desc_api: For the first 16 years of its existence, the trophy he was presented on Sunday went to the winner of the Canadian Open.

21.title_api: Canadian Open: Yes, Mackenzie, that was ‘way cooler’
21.caption_api: Mackenzie Hughes tees off on the 10th hole at the Canadian Open golf championship at Glen Abbey in Oakville.
21.desc_api: It was a pretty Canuck moment, the kind of sports marriage that the RBC Canadian Open people cherish in their fan-magnet “The Rink” area.

22.title_api: Playing OK, but Ticats can’t claw out a win against Winnipeg
22.desc_api: Stop us if you’ve heard this before, but the Hamilton Tiger-Cats head into a bye week off a loss.
22.caption_api: Blue Bombers’ Taylor Loffler and Chris Randle, right, chase down Hamilton Tiger-Cats’ quarterback Jeremiah Masoli as he drives for the goal line during second-half CFL action in Winnipeg on Friday night. The Ticats lost, 29-23.

23.title_api: Bombers defence holds Ticats off for 29-23 win

23.caption_api: Winnipeg Blue Bombers quarterback Matt Nichols (15) and Nic Demski (10) celebrate Demski’s touchdown during the second half of CFL action against the Hamilton Tiger-Cats, in Winnipeg on Friday, August 10, 2018. THE CANADIAN PRESS/John Woods

30.title_api: Learn new offence? Titans’ Blaine Gabbert on 8th in 8 years
30.desc_api: Learn new offence? Titans’ Blaine Gabbert on 8th in 8 years
30.caption_api: FILE - In this Aug. 9, 2018 file photo Tennessee Titans’ Blaine Gabbert throws during the first half of a preseason NFL football game against the Green Bay Packers in Green Bay, Wis. Gabbert quickly stopped the reporter asking the quarterback about learning his fourth offense in four years. The Titans, who signed Gabbert in March to back up Marcus Mariota, are just the fourth team that the quarterback has played for since being drafted by Jacksonville in 2011. But coach Mike Vrabel is the eight different head coach and yes, the eighth different scheme that Gabbert has had to learn since coming into the NFL from Missouri. (AP Photo/Matt Ludtke, file)

36.title_api: Duron Carter release nothing to do with working out Terrell Owens, Saskatchewan Roughriders say
36.desc_api: Chris Jones wasn’t prepared to divulge specific reasons as to why he released two-time all-star wide receiver Duron Carter, but working out NFL Hall-of-Famer Terrell Owens wasn’t one of them.
36.caption_api: Duron Carter played both offence and defence for the Saskatchewan Roughriders this season.

37.title_api: McNair lawyer calls for Maryland coach DJ Durkin to be fired
37.desc_api: McNair lawyer calls for Maryland coach DJ Durkin to be fired
37.caption_api: FILE - In this Dec. 26, 2016, file photo, Maryland head coach DJ Durkin walks the sideline during the first half of the Quick Lane Bowl NCAA college football game against Boston College in Detroit. Maryland placed the head of the football team’s strength and conditioning staff on paid leave while it investigates claims he verbally abused and humiliated players, a person briefed on the situation said. The person spoke to The Associated Press on Saturday, Aug. 11, 2018, on condition of anonymity because Maryland had not announced the decision regarding Rick Court. The person says athletic director Damon Evans spoke with the football team Saturday morning and Durkin was still leading the program. (AP Photo/Carlos Osorio, File)

38.desc_api: Saints add new defensive backs Nelson and Williams

39.title_api: Ticat legend honoured: From the Hall to the Wall
39.desc_api: Joe Montford has never forgotten that 1996 spring day — his first moment, ever, in Canada — when he arrived at the Hamilton Tiger-Cats training camp.
39.caption_api: Montford hams it up while waiting for a team photo to be snapped.

40.title_api: Ticats tackle discipline in wake of bye week
40.desc_api: Nobody keeps statistics during practice, but a layman’s eye noticed Hamilton Tiger-Cats on both sides of the ball jumping offside a few too many times in Sunday’s return from their bye week.
40.caption_api: Assistant coach Orlondo Steinhauer works with players at Tim Hortons Field on Sunday. It was the first practice for the Tiger-Cats after a bye week.

41.title_api: Former Ticat recalls altercation with police that resulted in career-ending injury
41.desc_api: “I really thought I was going to die that night,” said Orlando Bowen, who suffered a concussion in the incident
41.caption_api: Photos of Orlando Bowen after his arrest show him with gashes and swollen eyes, cheeks and lips.

43.title_api: Florida expects quick fix on defence after tumultuous 2017
43.desc_api: Florida expects quick fix on defence after tumultuous 2017
43.caption_api: FILE - In this July 25, 2017 file photo Mississippi State defensive coordinator Todd Grantham speaks to reporters about team goals this upcoming season during Media Day in Starkville, Miss. Florida‚Äôs defense last season was historically bad. The Gators allowed their most points per game since 1946 and their most yards per play since at least World War II. They are counting on Grantham making a huge difference. He has a recent history of quick fixes, including at Mississippi State last season. The Bulldogs improved from 93rd in scoring defense in 2016 to 26th in 2017, and jumped from 110th in total defense in 2016 to 10th. (AP Photo/Rogelio V. Solis, file)

44.title_api: Canadian punter Ryan signs with Buffalo Bills
44.desc_api: Source: Veteran Canadian punter Jon Ryan to sign contract with Buffalo Bills
44.caption_api: Seattle Seahawks punter Jon Ryan, left, runs with the ball during a drill at NFL football practice, Thursday, June 14, 2018, in Renton, Wash. It didn’t take Jon Ryan long to find new home. According to a source, the Regina-born punter has agreed to terms with the NFL’s Buffalo Bills. The move comes a day after the Seattle Seahawks released Ryan after 10 seasons.THE CANADIAN PRESS/AP, Ted S. Warren

47.title_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats face stiff test against Edmonton’s Mike Reilly
47.desc_api: Thursday’s Edmonton-Hamilton game could come down to whether the Tiger-Cats’ pass rush can disrupt Reilly, who hangs in the pocket longer than any quarterback in the CFL.
47.caption_api: Edmonton quarterback Mike Reilly comes in as the league’s top performe as his team prepares to visit the Hamilton Tiger-Cats on Thursday.
